answers.answer: HeyOMacc76.Let's see here. Do you experience pain related to your lumps?Are they hard, is there any pus, do you have any other conditionsor med. history related to these like surgery or diabetes?Please let me know, but my initial feeling is that you should see  probably a dermatologist and have it evaluated.The numbness is of concern as well, as it may have do with diabetes & circulatory issues or nerve compression.Best wishes,NikoBest wishes,Niko
I would say it could be calcified nodules and they are pressing on nerves when you sit. It might be a good idea to have this looked into.

question: I have two lumps on the outside of my right butt cheak slightly to the left of my hip bone. One is the size of a golf ball and the newly discovered one is slightly smaller. When i sit on the toilet or anywhere for that matter my entire right leg goes extremely numb. What do you think they are and or how can i fix this problem?
title: My question is about these lumps on my butt cheak.
